page.title: 06FARMING-TIRLAS GOCH.
page.content: The calves are all kept in different barns around the farm.Some were in groups others were separated.Later on when the calves that are to be kept for milking are a bit older they will have their horns burnt off.This is so that when the cows fight they don't injure each other.The vet is called out to the farm about every two and a half months on average.The last time he was called out was for a calf which had broken its legs by jumping through a door.There are seven workers on the farm.Their day starts at 6.am and finishes at 5.30.pm. The busiest time on the farm for them is July because that is the harvesting time for the silage which is used as fodder during the winter months when outdoor grazing is not possible.
